entry.title: The Social Security (Incapacity Benefit) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Social Security (Incapacity Benefit) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1994 (“the principal Regulations”) in consequence of the coming into operation of Articles 59 to 61 of the Welfare Reform and Pensions (Northern Ireland) Order 1999.

entry.title: The Borough of Rugby (Electoral Changes) (No. 2) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order revokes and replaces the Borough of Rugby (Electoral Changes) Order 2000 (“the 2000 Order”) which will not now come into force. The purpose of making the new Order is to depict the boundaries of the Dunchurch and Knightlow ward omitted from the map referred to in the 2000 Order and to establish the electoral cycle for the parishes mentioned or referred to in article 6.

entry.title: The Companies Act 1985 (Electronic Communications) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order which is made under sections 8 and 9 of the Electronic Communications Act 2000 (c. 7) modifies various provisions of the Companies Act 1985 (c. 6) (“the 1985 Act”) for the purpose of authorising or facilitating the use of electronic communications between companies and their members, debenture holders and auditors, and between companies and the registrar of companies.

entry.title: The Young Offender Institution Rules 2000

ukm:Subject.Value: YOUNG OFFENDER INSTITUTIONS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: YOUNG OFFENDER INSTITUTIONS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Rules make provision for the management of young offender institutions, including the treatment of inmates, the conduct of young offender institution officers, and the powers and duties of the boards of visitors. They revoke and replace the Young Offender Institution Rules 1988, as amended.

entry.title: The Public Telecommunication System Designation (Central North Sea Fibre Telecommunications Company Limited) Order 2000
entry.summary: The Secretary of State granted to Central North Sea Fibre Telecommunications Company Limited a licence on 1 November 2000 under section 7 of the Telecommunications Act 1984 to run the telecommunication systems specified in the licence. A copy of the licence was laid before Parliament on 21st December 2000. This Order designates those telecommunication systems as public telecommunication systems. Consequently, by virtue of section 9(3) of that Act, Central North Sea Fibre Telecommunications Company Limited will be a public telecommunications operator when the Order comes into force on 19th January 2001.

entry.title: The Public Telecommunication System Designation (Atlas Communications (UK) Ltd) Order 2000
entry.summary: The Secretary of State granted to Atlas Communications (UK) Ltd a licence on 21st August 2000 under section 7 of the Telecommunications Act 1984 to run the telecommunication systems specified in the licence. A copy of the licence was laid before Parliament on 21st December 2000. This Order designates those telecommunication systems as public telecommunication systems. Consequently, by virtue of section 9(3) of that Act, Atlas Communications (UK) Ltd will be a public telecommunications operator when the Order comes into force on 19th January 2001.

entry.title: The Public Telecommunication System Designation (TyCom Networks (UK) Limited) Order 2000
entry.summary: The Secretary of State granted to TyCom Networks (UK) Limited a licence on 21 August 2000 under section 7 of the Telecommunications Act 1984 to run the telecommunication systems specified in the licence. A copy of the licence was laid before Parliament on 21st December 2000. This Order designates those telecommunication systems as public telecommunication systems. Consequently, by virtue of section 9(3) of that Act, TyCom Networks (UK) Limited will be a public telecommunications operator when the Order comes into force on 19th January 2001.

entry.title: The Public Telecommunication System Designation (Cable & Wireless HKT Pacific (UK) Ltd) Order 2000
entry.summary: The Secretary of State granted to Cable & Wireless HKT Pacific (UK) Ltd a licence on 21st August 2000 under section 7 of the Telecommunications Act 1984 to run the telecommunication systems specified in the licence. A copy of the licence was laid before Parliament on 21st December 2000. This Order designates those telecommunication systems as public telecommunication systems. Consequently, by virtue of section 9(3) of that Act, Cable & Wireless HKT Pacific (UK) Ltd will be a public telecommunications operator when the Order comes into force on 19th January 2001.

entry.title: The Public Telecommunication System Designation (FPL Telecom Limited) Order 2000
entry.summary: The Secretary of State granted to FPL Telecom Limited a licence on 21st August 2000 under section 7 of the Telecommunications Act 1984 to run the telecommunication systems specified in the licence. A copy of the licence was laid before Parliament on 21st December 2000. This Order designates those telecommunication systems as public telecommunication systems. Consequently, by virtue of section 9(3) of that Act, FPL Telecom Limited will be a public telecommunications operator when the Order comes into force on 19th January 2001.

entry.title: The Producer Responsibility Obligations (Packaging Waste) Amendment (Scotland) Regulations 2000
The Magistrates' Courts (Amendment) Rules 2000
entry.summary: These Rules make a number of amendments to the Magistrates' Courts Rules 1981 (S.I. 1981/552) which are necessary in relation to the new procedure created by sections 51 and 52 of and Schedule 3 to the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (c. 37) (no committal proceedings for indictable-only offences).

entry.title: The Crown Court (Amendment) (No. 3) Rules 2000

ukm:Subject.Value: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Rules make a number of amendments to the Crown Court Rules 1982 (S.I. 1982/1109) which are necessary in relation to the new procedure created by sections 51 and 52 of and Schedule 3 to the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (c. 37) (no committal proceedings for indictable-only proceedings).

entry.title: The Census (Amendment) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Census Regulations 2000 which provide for the detailed arrangements necessary for the conduct of the 2001 Census.

entry.title: The Indictments (Procedure) (Amendment) Rules 2000
entry.summary: These Rules make a number of amendments to the Indictments (Procedure) Rules 1971 (S.I. 1971/2084) which are necessary in relation to the new procedure created by sections 51 and 52 of and Schedule 3 to the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (c. 37) (no committal proceedings for indictable-only offences).

entry.title: The Agricultural Business Development Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations introduce measures to supplement–

entry.title: The Police (Northern Ireland) Act 2000 (Commencement) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Commencement Order,which is the first to be made under the Police (Northern Ireland) Act 2000, brings into force on 22nd December 2000 the provisions of that Act specified in the Schedule to the Order.

entry.title: The Double Taxation Relief (Taxes on Income) (Dividends, etc.) (Revocations) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke certain Regulations under which additional foreign tax on foreign dividends received in the United Kingdom on behalf of persons not resident in the United Kingdom is withheld or deducted by collecting agents or by the Inland Revenue.

entry.title: The Immigration (Designation of Travel Bans) (Amendment) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order amends the Immigration (Designation of Travel Bans) Order 2000 by adding Common Position 2000/696/CFSP of 10th November 2000 to the list of instruments made by the Council of the European Union which are designated for the purposes of section 8B of the Immigration Act 1971 (as inserted by section 8 of the Immigration and Asylum Act 1999). Any person named by or under a designated instrument, or of a description specified in it, will be excluded from the United Kingdom (subject to the exceptions specified in article 3 of the Immigration (Designation of Travel Bans) Order 2000).

entry.title: The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 5) (Scotland) Revocation Order 2000
The Consular Fees Act 1980 (Fees) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order specifies functions and matters which are to be taken into account in the determination of fees fixed by Her Majesty by Order in Council under section 1 of the Consular Fees Act 1980.
